Player History
Had first career hit on 4/3/1985, off Nolan Ryan (NYG)...
Injured on 5/4/1985 with a Bruised Jaw, out for one week...
Hit first career homerun on 5/17/1985, off Matt Young (SEA)...
Drove in 6 runs against New York (G) on 5/28/1985...
Was selected to the 1985 Allstar game...
Signed as a free agent by Seattle on 2/10/1986 to a 4-year deal worth $6,750,000 per year...
Was selected to the 1986 Allstar game...
Drove in 6 runs against New York (Y) on 7/30/1986...
Was selected to the 1987 Allstar game...
Won Gold Glove Award at Catcher in 1987...
Traded from Seattle to St. Louis on 5/26/1989 (Going to STL: P Russ Springer, C Rich Gedman. Going to SEA: C Mike Lavalliere, SS Ozzie Smith)...
Signed as a free agent by Kansas City on 2/3/1990 to a 2-year deal worth $2,590,000 per year...
Drove in 6 runs against Toronto on 5/17/1991...
